text: The Copenhagen Connection is a 1982 mystery novel by American writer Barbara Mertz published under the pseudonym Elizabeth Peters . It tells the story of American scholar Elizabeth Jones who during a sabbatical in Copenhagen, Denmark, meets her idol, brilliant Nobel Prize-Laureate Margaret Rosenberg in Copenhagen Airport and becomes her private assistant. Shortly after, Rosenberg is kidnapped and Jones sets out to find her. ==References== Category:American mystery novels Category:1992 American novels Category:Novels set in Copenhagen Category:Works published under a pseudonym
